title: Setup and install errors on ERDC-DSRC Onyx (Cray)
body:
### Summary
`. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh` fails on ERDC-DSRC Onyx (Cray XC40/50).

Subsequent `spack install` commands fail as well.

### Expected Result
Setup environment variables and install packages.

### Actual Result
Running the `setup-env.sh` command returns:
```
readline: /etc/inputrc: line 19: term: unknown variable name
```

Trying to install `eigen` or `cereal` returns the same error with regards to `ncurses`:
```
==> Installing ncurses
==> Error: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 471)
SyntaxError: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 471)

/dependencies/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:684, in child_process:
     27    
     28                # build up some context from the offending package so we can
     29                # show that, too.
  >> 30                package_context = get_package_context(tb)
     31    
     32                build_log = None
     33                if hasattr(pkg, 'log_path'):
```

### Steps to Reproduce the Issues
#### `setup-env.sh` error:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ . spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
```

Line 19 in `/etc/inputrc` is:
```
set term xy
```


#### Install error:
```console
$ spack install eigen
```

I'm able to run the `setup-env.sh` and `install` commands on my local machine just fine. It's only on the Cray machine that I'm having these issues. 

Any insights would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance!

### System Information
Platform:
```
$ uname -a
Linux onyx07 3.12.61-52.111-default #1 SMP Tue Jan 9 14:03:30 UTC 2018 (75215ba) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
Onyx is a Cray XC40/50.

Bash version is:
```
$ echo $BASH_VERSION 
4.2.47(1)-release
```
